author: @cartacapital
title: Irlanda anuncia sua primeira doação ao Fundo Amazônia, de R$ 91 milhões
text:
A Irlanda anunciou, nesta quarta-feira 12 que doará 15 milhões de euros (o equivalente a cerca de 91 milhões de reais) ao Fundo Amazônia nos próximos três anos. Esta será a primeira contribuição da Irlanda ao fundo, que conta agora com oito doadores.
“Tudo isso faz a diferença, porque o que nós queremos é um novo ciclo de prosperidade, sobretudo no contexto de agravamento da mudança do clima”, comemorou a ministra do Meio Ambiente Marina Silva . anúncio ocorreu em São Paulo, durante reunião entre Marina e o ministro dos Transportes irlandês, Seán Canney.
Segundo o governo federal, apenas em 2024, foram internalizados no Fundo Amazônia cerca de 1 bilhão de reais em doações contratadas em 2023 e 2024, de seis diferentes países.
O Fundo Amazônia tem em sua carteira 123 projetos apoiados, no valor total de 3,1 bilhões de reais , sendo mais de 200 milhões de reais somente em 2024.
Além da Irlanda, sete países já realizaram doações ao Fundo: Noruega, Alemanha, EUA, Reino Unido, Dinamarca, Suíça e Japão , além da Petrobras, superando 4,5 bilhões de reais em contribuições ao longo dos 16 anos de atuação.
Gerido pelo Banco Nacional de Desenvolvimento Econômico e Social do Brasil (BNDES) sob a coordenação do Ministério do Meio Ambiente e Mudança do Clima (MMA), o Fundo é a maior iniciativa mundial para a redução de emissões por desmatamento e degradação florestal.

author: 证券时报网
title: 首开股份：6月公司共实现签约金额20.68亿元 环比上升38.91%
text: 人民财讯7月10日电， 首开股份 （ 600376 ）7月10日晚间发布2025年6月份销售情况简报，2025年6月份，公司共实现签约面积13.30万平方米，环比上升41.34%；签约金额20.68亿元，环比上升38.91%。2025年1—6月份，公司共实现签约面积72.07万平方米；签约金额114.07亿元。

author: KNS
title: Chief Justice of J&K Inspires Conservation at Chatlam Wetland Reserve
text: J&KChief Justice of J&K Inspires Conservation at Chatlam Wetland Reserve By KNS Posted on Dec 29, 2023 | Updated on Dec 29, 2023 Share Tweet Share Srinagar, Dec 29 (KNS): In a remarkable display of commitment to environmental stewardship, Justice N. Kotiswar Singh, the Chief Justice of Jammu and Kashmir, presided over a birding event at the picturesque Chatlam Wetland Reserve in Pampore. The event aimed not only to appreciate the diverse avian life but also to rally the community and students towards active participation in conservation efforts. During the event, Chief Justice Singh emphasized the critical role each individual plays in preserving the delicate balance of nature. He encouraged students and community members alike to embrace a proactive approach to conservation, underscoring the significance of protecting vital ecosystems like Chatlam Wetland Reserve. As the Chief Justice observed various bird species in their natural habitat, he shared insights into the symbiotic relationship between biodiversity and a healthy environment. His presence served as a catalyst for heightened awareness, fostering a sense of responsibility among attendees towards the region's rich ecological heritage. The birding event at Chatlam Wetland Reserve, led by the Chief Justice, stands as a testament to the judiciary's commitment to broader societal issues. It not only celebrated the diverse birdlife of the region but also sought to ignite a collective sense of duty towards preserving the natural wonders that contribute to the cultural and environmental identity of Jammu and Kashmir.(KNS) Related Categories:Sports Share Tweet Share Recommended for you Lt Governor calls upon youth to build ‘Viksit Bharat’ Secretary YSS chairs preliminary meeting of Khelo India Winter Games PS Shergari recognized among top three Police Stations in Country

author: СУ Св. Климент Охридски
title: Volodymyr Zelensky: Putin wants Odessa and then reach the borders of Moldova and Romania
text:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that Russia plans to seize Odessa and then reach the borders of Moldova and Romania, stressing the importance of supporting a European Moldova, Channel 24 reports.
Zelensky, who is hosting a summit in Odessa, emphasizes that if a European Moldova wins this year, it will encourage Russia to interfere even more in the affairs of the countries of Southeast Europe.
"Support for a European Moldova, and not pro-Russian or oligarchic forces, is an extremely important task for all of us," Zelensky stated.
The president added that Russia's plans include capturing Odessa. All this to reach the borders of Moldova and Romania.
"We are here in Odessa, a city that Russia wants to destroy, as it has destroyed countless other cities. Russian military plans are aimed at this region, and then at the borders of Moldova and Romania. We need protection now. But even more, we need long-term guarantees that this will never happen again," the Ukrainian leader said.
At the same time, Moldovan President Maia Sadu stressed that Russia will not stop even in her country if it is not stopped in Ukraine.
"Russia is abusing Ukrainian soil and attacking with hybrid weapons: lies, manipulation, blackmail, interfering in the political system, distorting democracy and trying to push partners away from Ukraine. Russia will not stop even in Moldova if it is not stopped in Ukraine. We need to help faster, more decisively, if Ukraine does not get what it needs, it will be too late," Sandu said.
She also added that it is necessary to support the "center for preventing hybrid threats" in Odessa. In addition, Sandu highlighted "the need to stop illicit money flows, strengthen energy cooperation and jointly build cybersecurity".
Volodymyr Zelensky: Putin wants Odessa and then reach the borders of Moldova and Romania
